      • manager

      • forUuid

        public static Healthchecks forUuid(String uuid)

        Creates a new healthchecks.io Client.


        Currently supported messages:

        • start(): The process which the check tracks just started.
        • success(): The process which the check tracks completed successfully.
        • fail(): The process which the check tracks failed (this will cause an alert!).

        Optionally, you can also pass a parameter String body which will be stored together with your status message on healthchecks.io.

        All requests will be sent asynchronously and return a CompletableFuture with a Response object.

        Use CompletableFuture.get() to retrieve your response!

        Parameters:
        uuid - The universal unique identifier (UUID) of your check. You will find this one your check dashboard. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        A new Healthchecks client, which you can use

      • forUuid

        public static Healthchecks forUuid(String hostUrl,
                                   String uuid)

        Creates a new healthchecks.io Client for a custom host.


        Currently supported messages:

        • start(): The process which the check tracks just started.
        • success(): The process which the check tracks completed successfully.
        • fail(): The process which the check tracks failed (this will cause an alert!).

        Optionally, you can also pass a parameter String body which will be stored together with your status message on healthchecks.io.

        All requests will be sent asynchronously and return a CompletableFuture with a Response object.

        Use CompletableFuture.get() to retrieve your response!

        Parameters:
        hostUrl - The URL of your custom healthchecks instance. Normally, that's hc-ping.com, then you can use the constructor with only one parameter: forUuid(String) If you have a self-hosted instance, you can use this one as well. Must not be null.
        uuid - The universal unique identifier (UUID) of your check. You will find this one your check dashboard. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        A new Healthchecks client, which you can use
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the hostUrl is invalid. The bare minimum is something like http://localhost, but the Protocol (http/https), Host (e.g. hc-ping.com), (optionally) custom Port (e.g. 8080) and subpath (e.g. /healthchecks) will be taken into account as well!

      • validateUrl

        protected static String validateUrl(String host)

      • start

        public CompletableFuture<okhttp3.Response> start()

        Notifies healthchecks.io about the start of an event.

        Returns:

      • start

        public CompletableFuture<okhttp3.Response> start(String body)

        Notifies healthchecks.io about the start of an event.

        Parameters:
        body - A message (plain text) which will be stored on healthchecks.io, together with this status message.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture with a * Response object. Use CompletableFuture.get() to retrieve your response!

      • exitCode

        public CompletableFuture<okhttp3.Response> exitCode(int code)

        Notifies healthchecks.io about the completion of an event with the exit code code.

        Parameters:
        code - The exit code of the event (0-255). If the code is equal to 0, healthchecks.io will interpret this as a success, all other exit codes will raise an alert!
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture with a * Response object. Use CompletableFuture.get() to retrieve your response!

      • exitCode

        public CompletableFuture<okhttp3.Response> exitCode(int code,
                                                    String body)

        Notifies healthchecks.io about the completion of an event with the exit code code.

        Parameters:
        code - The exit code of the event (0-255). If the code is equal to 0, healthchecks.io will interpret this as a success, all other exit codes will raise an alert!
        body - A message (plain text) which will be stored on healthchecks.io, together with this status message.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture with a * Response object. Use CompletableFuture.get() to retrieve your response!
